codeList: Cell line - derived from xenograft tumour
Metastatic tumour - metastasis local to lymph node

Xenograft - derived from tumour cell line

meta.notes: If specimen is a tumor

data.description: Indicate the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of primary diagnosis (prior to treatment).

left.name: clinical_stage_group
left.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

meta.notes: This field is dependent on the selected tumour_staging_system

data.name: clinical_stage_group
data.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

meta.notes: This field is dependent on the selected tumour_staging_system

left.name: m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: m_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

notes.data: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

left.name: treatment_type
left.description: Indicate the type of treatment the donor received.

right.name: treatment_type
right.description: Indicate the type of treatment regimen that the donor completed.

meta.notes:
Depending on the treatment_type(s) selected, additional treatment details may be required to be submitted. For example, if treatment_type includes 'Chemotherapy', the supplemental Chemotherapy treatment type file is required.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

description.data: Indicate the type of treatment regimen that the donor completed.

notes.data:
Depending on the treatment_type(s) selected, additional treatment details may be required to be submitted. For example, if treatment_type includes 'Chemotherapy', the supplemental Chemotherapy treatment type file is required.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

left.name: smoking_pack_years
left.description: Number of packs of cigarette multiplied by the number of cigarettes smoked

meta.notes: Pack-years is calculated by multiplying the number of packs of cigarettes (20 cigarettes per pack) smoked per day by the number of years the person has smoked. For example, 1 pack year is equal to smoking 1 pack per day for 1 year

right.name: smoking_pack_years
right.description: Number of packs of cigarette multiplied by the number of cigarettes smoked

meta.notes: Pack-years is calculated by multiplying the number of packs of cigarettes smoked per day by the number of years the person has smoked. For example, 1 pack year is equal to smoking 1 pack per day for 1 year

notes.data: Pack-years is calculated by multiplying the number of packs of cigarettes smoked per day by the number of years the person has smoked. For example, 1 pack year is equal to smoking 1 pack per day for 1 year

right.name: program_id

meta.notes: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Program Services area. For example, TEST-CA is a Program ID.

data.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

meta.notes: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Program Services area. For example, TEST-CA is a Program ID.

right.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

data.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
data.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: pathological_t_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumour (T), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

data.name: pathological_t_category
data.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumour (T), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: pathological_n_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether or not the cancer has reached nearby lymph nodes (N), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

data.name: pathological_n_category
data.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether or not the cancer has reached nearby lymph nodes (N), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: pathological_m_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether there are distant metastases (M), meaning spread of cancer to other parts of the body, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

data.name: pathological_m_category
data.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether there are distant metastases (M), meaning spread of cancer to other parts of the body, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: pathological_stage_group
right.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on pathological_tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

data.name: pathological_stage_group
data.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on pathological_tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

right.name: specimen_acquisition_interval
right.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

meta.notes: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

data.name: specimen_acquisition_interval
data.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

meta.notes: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

right.name: tumour_histological_type
right.description: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

data.name: tumour_histological_type
data.description: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: specimen_anatomic_location
right.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected. Refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

data.name: specimen_anatomic_location
data.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected. Refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

right.name: specimen_processing
right.description: Indicate the technique used to process specimen.

codeList: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

data.name: specimen_processing
data.description: Indicate the technique used to process specimen.

codeList: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

right.name: specimen_storage
right.description: Indicate the method of specimen storage for specimens that were not extracted freshly or immediately cultured.

meta.notes: For specimens that were freshly extracted or immediately cultured, select Not Applicable.

data.name: specimen_storage
data.description: Indicate the method of specimen storage for specimens that were not extracted freshly or immediately cultured.

meta.notes: For specimens that were freshly extracted or immediately cultured, select Not Applicable.

right.name: reference_pathology_confirmed
right.description: Indicate whether the pathological diagnosis was confirmed by a (central) reference pathologist.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

data.name: reference_pathology_confirmed
data.description: Indicate whether the pathological diagnosis was confirmed by a (central) reference pathologist.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: tumour_grading_system
right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the description of a tumour based on how abnormal the tumour cells and the tumour tissue look under a microscope. Tumour grade is an indicator of how quickly a tumour is likely to grow.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

codeList: WHO grading system for CNS tumours

data.name: tumour_grading_system
data.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the description of a tumour based on how abnormal the tumour cells and the tumour tissue look under a microscope. Tumour grade is an indicator of how quickly a tumour is likely to grow.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

codeList: WHO grading system for CNS tumours

right.name: tumour_grade
right.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected tumour_grading_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Grading Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-grading-classifications

data.name: tumour_grade
data.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected tumour_grading_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Grading Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-grading-classifications

right.name: percent_tumour_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of infiltration by tumour cells in a specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

data.name: percent_tumour_cells
data.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of infiltration by tumour cells in a specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: percent_proliferating_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

data.name: percent_proliferating_cells
data.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: percent_inflammatory_tissue
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents local response to cellular injury, marked by capillary dilatation, edema and leukocyte infiltration; clinically, inflammation is manifest by redness, heat, pain, swelling and loss of function, with the need to heal damaged tissue.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

data.name: percent_inflammatory_tissue
data.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents local response to cellular injury, marked by capillary dilatation, edema and leukocyte infiltration; clinically, inflammation is manifest by redness, heat, pain, swelling and loss of function, with the need to heal damaged tissue.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: percent_stromal_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a malignant tumour specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

data.name: percent_stromal_cells
data.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a malignant tumour specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: percent_necrosis
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumour specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

data.name: percent_necrosis
data.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumour specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: program_id
right.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

right.name: age_at_consent_for_treatment
right.description: Indicate the age of donor when consent was given for treatment.

data.name: age_at_consent_for_treatment
data.description: Indicate the age of donor when consent was given for treatment.

right.name: is_primary_treatment
right.description: Indicate if the treatment was the primary treatment following the initial diagnosis.

data.name: is_primary_treatment
data.description: Indicate if the treatment was the primary treatment following the initial diagnosis.

right.name: line_of_treatment
right.description: Indicate the line of treatment if it is not the primary treatment.

data.name: line_of_treatment
data.description: Indicate the line of treatment if it is not the primary treatment.

right.name: treatment_start_interval
right.description: The interval between the primary diagnosis and initiation of treatment, in days.

meta.notes: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

data.name: treatment_start_interval
data.description: The interval between the primary diagnosis and initiation of treatment, in days.

meta.notes: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

right.name: treatment_duration
right.description: The duration of treatment regimen, in days.

data.name: treatment_duration
data.description: The duration of treatment regimen, in days.

right.name: days_per_cycle
right.description: Indicate the number of days in a treatment cycle.

data.name: days_per_cycle
data.description: Indicate the number of days in a treatment cycle.

right.name: number_of_cycles
right.description: Indicate the number of treatment cycles.

data.name: number_of_cycles
data.description: Indicate the number of treatment cycles.

right.name: therapeutic_intent
right.description: The therapeutic intent, the reason behind the choice of a therapy, of the treatment.

data.name: therapeutic_intent
data.description: The therapeutic intent, the reason behind the choice of a therapy, of the treatment.

right.name: response_to_therapy
right.description: The donor's response to the applied treatment regimen. (Source: RECIST)

data.name: response_to_therapy
data.description: The donor's response to the applied treatment regimen. (Source: RECIST)

right.name: outcome_of_therapy
right.description: Indicate the donor's outcome of the prescribed treatment.

codeList: Treatment incomplete due to technical or organizational problems
Treatment stopped due to lack of efficacy (disease progression)
Treatment stopped due to acute toxicity

data.name: outcome_of_therapy
data.description: Indicate the donor's outcome of the prescribed treatment.

codeList: Treatment incomplete due to technical or organizational problems
Treatment stopped due to lack of efficacy (disease progression)
Treatment stopped due to acute toxicity

right.name: toxicity_type
right.description: If the treatment was terminated early due to acute toxicity, indicate whether it was due to hemotological toxicity or non-hemotological toxicity.

data.name: toxicity_type
data.description: If the treatment was terminated early due to acute toxicity, indicate whether it was due to hemotological toxicity or non-hemotological toxicity.

right.name: hemotological_toxicity
right.description: Indicate the hemotological toxicities which caused early termination of the treatment. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

data.name: hemotological_toxicity
data.description: Indicate the hemotological toxicities which caused early termination of the treatment. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

right.name: adverse_events
right.description: Report any treatment related adverse events. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

Congenital, familial and genetic disorders - Other, specify

Skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders - Other, specify
Surgical and medical procedures - Other, specify

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

right.name: clinical_trials_database
right.description: If the donor is a participant in a clinical trial, indicate the clinical trial database where the clinical trial is registered.

data.name: clinical_trials_database
data.description: If the donor is a participant in a clinical trial, indicate the clinical trial database where the clinical trial is registered.

right.description: Based on the clinical_trial_database, indicate the unique NCT or EudraCT clinical trial identifier of which the donor is a participant.
